title: Graduate Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
A Future with purpose

At Arup were dedicated to sustainable development and to do socially useful work that has meaning. Our purpose, shared values and collaborative approach has set us apart for over 75 years, guiding how we shape a better world.

We solve the world&aposs most complex problems and deliver what seems impossible. We explore challenges with curiosity and creativity - using technology, imagination and rigour to deliver remarkable outcomes.

The Opportunity

Working with the Buildings Team, the Graduate Engineer will assist structural team in the accomplishment of assigned Projects and deliver accurate and correct drawings, calculations and analysis.

As a graduate, youll transition from academic learning to real-world applications, working on diverse projects that challenge your problem-solving skills and creativity. This role provides a structured environment where you can develop your technical skills, gain hands-on experience, and receive mentorship from experienced engineers.

The role is based in Manila office.

Your role in our team

  • Prepares design calculations based on the specific requirements of the project assigned by Team Leader
  • Ensure timeliness and accuracy of own output by checking against required standards and agreed deadlines.
  • Coordinates work with other disciplines.
  • Fulfils other responsibilities assigned from time to time.

At Arup, you belong to an extraordinary collective in which we support individuality to thrive. Our strength comes from how we respect, share and connect our diverse experiences, perspectives and ideas. You will have the opportunity do socially useful work that has meaning to Arup, to your career, to our members and to the clients and communities we serve.

Is this role right for you

  • Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering; licensed or Registered Engineer is preferred.
  • Preferred: 1-2 years of experience, but fresh graduates are encouraged to apply.
  • With programming skills and experience is a must. Programming software such as Visual Basic, C-Plus, C-sharp, MathLab, etc.
  • Able to provide and develop design calculations, develop detailed drawings and prepare specifications.
  • Be able to demonstrate strong design ability and engineering solutions on major and/or complex projects.
  • Engineering design skills and knowledge in building services system
  • Able to adapt both local and international standards (i.e. US standards, BS, JIS, etc.)
  • Excellent communications skills (both written and verbal) essential for team-based working and must be able to prepare project correspondences and reports.
  • Excellent skills with Microsoft applications (word, excel, PowerPoint)
  • Knowledge and practical experience of general analysis, design software an advantage
  • Must be motivated, proactive and willing to take on new challenges.
  • Must be able to maintain and develop successful client relationships and must be a team player and keen learner.
  • Able to work independently with minimum supervision and should be a team player and open to co-ordinating with engineers of other trades / inter-disciplinary coordination.
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines is essential
  • Must be willing to be assigned to project site and shall be readily available to conduct site inspection and survey.
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines is essential.
  • Able to understand the balance of engineering priorities on differing project

Were looking for people who are curious and ready to evolve how you think and work. Our strength comes from how we respect, share and connect our diverse experiences, perspectives and ideas. At Arup, you belong to an extraordinary collective in which we encourage individuality to thrive. If you can share your knowledge and ideas and encourage others to do the same; whilst having a desire to deliver excellent services for clients wed like to hear from you.

Not ready to apply just yet or have some questions Contact Ivy at [HIDDEN TEXT]

What We Offer You

At Arup, we care about each members success, so we can grow together.

Guided by our values, we provide an attractive total reward that recognises the contribution of each of our members to our shared success. As well as competitive, fair and equitable pay, we offer a career in which all of our members can belong, grow and thrive through benefits that support health and wellbeing, a wide range of learning opportunities and many possibilities to have an impact through the work they do.

We are owned in trust on behalf of our members, giving us the freedom, with personal responsibility, to set our own direction and choose work that aligns with our purpose and adds to Arups legacy. Our members collaborate on ambitious projects to deliver remarkable outcomes for our clients and communities.

Profit Share is a key part of our reward, enabling members to share in the results of our collective efforts. We also provide medical insurance, life assurance, accident insurance. In addition, we offer flexible work hours and a hybrid work arrangement.

Different People, Shared Values

Arup is an equal opportunity employer that actively promotes and nurtures a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of age (within legal limits), gender identity or expression, marital status, disability, neurotype or mental health, race or ethnicity, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether youre pregnant or on family leave. We are an open environment that embraces diverse experiences, perspectives, and ideas this drives our excellence.

Guided by our values and alignment with the UN Sustainable Development Goals, we create and contribute to equitable spaces and systems, while cultivating a sense of belonging for all. Our internal employee networks support our inclusive culture: from race, ethnicity and cross-cultural working to gender equity and LGBTQ+ and disability inclusion we aim to create a space for you to express yourself and make a positive difference. Discover more about life at Arup at www.arup.com/careers/your-life-at-arup.

We are committed to making our recruitment process and workplaces accessible to all candidates. Please contact Ivy Baguis at [HIDDEN TEXT] to let us know if you need any assistance or reasonable adjustments throughout your application or interview process, and/or to perform the essential functions of the role. We will do everything we can to support you.

Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the employers personal data policies, a copy of which is available on Arups Legal page.

title: Mechanical Engineer  HVAC
job_desc:
SYSTRA is one of the world's leading engineering and consultancy groups specialising in public transport and sustainable mobility. With over 10,300 employees, SYSTRA's mission is to design safe and sustainable transport solutions to bring people together, develop social inclusion and facilitate access to employment, education and leisure throughout the world.

For 65 years, the Group has been working alongside cities and regions to contribute to their development by creating, improving and modernising their infrastructure and transport systems, throughout the life cycle of their projects. SYSTRA is involved from the earliest stages of design through to the testing, deployment and maintenance phases. The company provides all its services in over 80 countries worldwide and generates 74% of its turnover internationally. With its new services, SYSTRA supports its clients and partners in their digital, ecological and energy transition, in order to invent the mobility of tomorrow.

Context

The position will be responsible for implementing project design and improvement to existing products in accordance with design plans. The position will also provide ground up mechanical support for sustainable railway and infrastructure efforts.

Missions/Main Duties

  • Collaborate with various functions to determine mechanical applications and requirements;
  • Conduct research to inform the design and engineering methods required for the mechanical systems;
  • Plan and execute mechanical designs using CAD, CAM, 3D CAD or other applicable programs and software;
  • Document the design process, iterations, and test analytics.
  • Liaise with clients, designers, engineers, and manufacturers to ensure coherence;
  • Prepare technical reports, design specifications documents, and operational manuals; and
  • Keep abreast of the latest advancements in technology, design trends, and engineering best practices.
  • Specify Heating , ventilation and Air conditioning Equipment to meet room design requirements
  • Plan the placement of pipework, ducting and control panels
  • Instruct draftsman to prepare design drawings
  • Preparing design calculations and reports
  • Prepare equipment specifications

Profile/Skills

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering;
  • A minimum of two (3) years of experience as a mechanical design engineer;
  • Proficiency with engineering design programs such as AutoCAD, Solidworks and Rhino;
  • Experience in Carrier HAP
  • Smoke simulation software
  • Sound knowledge of design and engineering principles and best practices;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities;
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication abilities;
  • Attentive to detail and critically minded; and
  • The ability to stay abreast of advancements in technology and engineering design trends.

Systra is an equal opportunities company; this position is open to all applicants.

title: Mechanical Engineer: Fire Protection
job_desc:
SYSTRA is one of the world&aposs leading engineering and consultancy groups specialising in public transport and sustainable mobility. With over 10,300 employees, SYSTRA&aposs mission is to design safe and sustainable transport solutions to bring people together, develop social inclusion and facilitate access to employment, education and leisure throughout the world.

For 65 years, the Group has been working alongside cities and regions to contribute to their development by creating, improving and modernising their infrastructure and transport systems, throughout the life cycle of their projects. SYSTRA is involved from the earliest stages of design through to the testing, deployment and maintenance phases. The company provides all its services in over 80 countries worldwide and generates 74% of its turnover internationally. With its new services, SYSTRA supports its clients and partners in their digital, ecological and energy transition, in order to invent the mobility of tomorrow.

Context

Job Title Mechanical Engineer: Fire Protection

Reports To: MEPF Manager

Position Summary: The position will be responsible for implementing conceptual & detailed project design and improvement to fire detection & protection in accordance with design plans. The position will also provide ground up mechanical support for sustainable railway and infrastructure efforts.

Missions/Main Duties

Key Activities

  • Collaborate with various fields to determine the applications and requirements;
  • Conduct research and site inspection to comply the design and engineering requirements as specified in the employers requirements for the fire protection systems & HVAC;
  • Plan and execute mechanical designs using CAD, CAM, 3D CAD, Revit or BIM and other applicable calculation programs and software to produce optimal design;
  • Has strong exposure in the Fire Detection, Protection design & execution , preferably with exposure as designer of Kidde, Honeywell-Notifier, Mircom, FM200, NOVEC1230, CO2, Inert Gas & interface to auxiliary systems(FDAS), familiarity of building & Fire Code of the Philippines, NFPA & other international codes and standards.
  • Liaise with clients, designers, engineers, and manufacturers to ensure coherence;
  • Prepare technical reports, design specifications documents, and operational manuals; and keep abreast of the latest advancements in technology, design trends, and engineering best practices.

Profile/Skills

Qualifications / Skills And Knowledge Requirements

  • Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering & other related field;
  • A minimum of five (5) years of experience as a fire protection design engineer;
  • Proficiency with engineering design programs such as AutoCAD, Solidworks and Rhino;
  • Sound knowledge of design and engineering principles and best practices in Fire Protection, Suppression and Alarm systems, HVAC and conducting site inspection & survey;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities & as peer reviewer of other designer;
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication abilities;
  • Attentive to detail and critically minded; and
  • The ability to stay abreast of advancements in technology and engineering design trends.

Educational Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering and other related field;
  • Masters Degree is an advantage

Systra is an equal opportunities company; this position is open to all applicants.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
An exciting opportunity is waiting for you in AP Renewables Inc., (An AboitizPower Business Unit). We are currently looking for A-Talents to join our team as Mechanical Engineer. The position shall be responsible for the Mechanical planning, review, and the implementation of the plant&aposs maintenance and asset management plans and procedures relating to the plant Mechanical Systems. This position will support or lead project implementation of the life cycle of plant systems relating to Mechanical Systems. Moreover, the position will also assist the Reliability Supervisor in the implementation and continuous improvement of the different Reliability Team objectives and Reliability Engineering Department activities.

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Establishes and leads the implementation, reviews and improves asset management system such as Reliability Centered Maintenance (Failure Mode Analysis), Asset Condition Assessment (ACA), Failure Mode, Effects, Critical Assessment (FMECA), and Root Cause Analysis (RCA) in alignment with the Asset management policies and procedures.
  • Review, Recommend and Supports the APRI Policies, Procedures, and Guidelines relating to the Plant Mechanical and Piping Systems. This position will lead the governance for the APRI implementation of necessary document compliance or localization.
  • Leads Root-Cause Analysis (RCA) process for all Technical incidents and monitors all recommended corrective action items as delegated by the supervisor.
  • Plans, reviews, asses and implements Engineering projects. These includes consideration of the asset life cycle, system process improvements, strategic planning and collaboration with other departments.
  • Reviews and provides technical expertise and assists in the implementation of Management and Change (MOC) initiation review, specifically for Mechanical related, and ensures any change was recorded and managed accordingly.
  • Identifies the risks in terms of reliability engineering and suggests solutions to the direct team leader (identify equipment failures and risk treatment plans).

Requirements:

At least 2 years relevant experience in the Power Generation Industry

Graduate of B.S. Mechanical Engineering

Registered Mechanical Engineer

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
Job Responsibilities

  • Responsible for contributing to and where appropriate leading R&D engineering projects. Undertakes a role in the development and design of engineering services, implementing new ideas and new technologies for Mechanical or Electrical installations, systems, equipment, etc. in data centers (DCs).
  • Researches new and emerging technologies (including renewables) in DC engineering and where appropriate implement them into test designs.
  • Innovate new designs that aim to make the operational & construction environmental Impact of DCs as positive as possible.
  • Seek to be at the forefront of new thinking for Net Zero Carbon DC design, Artificial Intelligence & liquid cooling technologies.
  • Create designs and engineering solutions that can then be implemented into client projects. Work with RED project teams to implement new solutions into live project designs. Interest and ability to work on whole life cycle analysis (WLCA).
  • Contribute to the RED library of concept designs and ensure these are up to date with new solutions.
  • Present new design solutions both internally and to external clients. Generate white papers and technical articles for publication.
  • Present innovative engineering ideas and solutions at industry events. Day to day decision making on project progress and direct liaison with and provides advice to clients.
  • Can be mentored to represents RED at technical meetings with customers, professional teams and contractors teams.
  • Ensures engineering calculations and drawings meet required robust industry & legal standards. Can contribute to project & engineering coordination
  • Takes a holistic view in the selection and application of engineering concepts and solutions

Job Qualifications:

  • Bachelor, MSc/MEng or PhD in appropriate engineering discipline.
  • Member of CIBSE/IMechE/IET or working towards Membership of a Professional Institution. At least 2 years experience in the design of building services with at least 1 years experience in the design of DCs.
  • Ability to research
  • Ability to think innovatively
  • Good understanding of mechanical/electrical engineering from first principles .
  • Ability to prioritize own workload.
  • Ability to work to deadlines.
  • Managerial &Presentation skills.
  • Technical report writing skills.
  • Sound knowledge of key Health & Safety issues and legislation
  • Knowledge of MS Office applications word, excel, etc.
  • Ability to use IT based calculation and spreadsheet software Basic working knowledge of CAD functionality
  • Good understanding of BS EN standards / UK Regulations / Codes / UTI / UKGBC
  • Good understanding of the world climate emergency
  • Understanding of or willingness to develop modeling capabilities for system Reliability.
  • Background in consulting or construction preferred.
  • Good understanding of international working and business operations of a global consultancy.
  • Act in an ethical manner and follow the principles of the Ethics Charter and Ethics in Practice Guidelines of the Group.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
San Miguel Brewery Inc., the largest and leading beer producer in the Philippines, is seeking talented and driven individuals to join our dynamic team. We offer exciting career opportunities across various functions, including sales, logistics, finance, marketing, and production. Be a part of an iconic company known for its strong brands and commitment to excellence. Join us and help shape the future of the beer industry in the Philippines!

Position:Transportation Management Coordinator

Responsibilities

  • Monitor fleet performance, fuel consumption, and maintenance schedule
  • Ensure compliance with safety and government transport requirements
  • Coordinate vehicle repairs, preventive maintenance, and inspections

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • With valid driver's license (preferably Professional driver's license)
  • Can drive both automatic and manual transmission
  • Analytical skills and project management abilities
  • Effective communication and customer service skills

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
Mechanical Engineer monitors the mechanical construction work for horizontal and vertical projects on the owner-developer side. This includes coordinating activities among the project team and external suppliers and communicating progress reports to management. This scope of work extends to the entire Daiichi Properties group of companies and its associations, including current and future additions.

Job Requirements:
  • Holder of a Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering.
  • Must be a Licensed Mechanical Engineer with at least 3-5 years of relevant experience in project management/ construction or real estate development.
  • Knowledgeable in Quantity Surveying.
  • Proficiency in Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software, particularly AutoCAD, and MS Office applications.
  • Driven to exceed expectations, willing to go an extra mile and with high sense of urgency.

    • Job Responsibilities:
    • Review mechanical designs and plans to ensure compliance with project requirements.
    • Supervises and monitors mechanical installations and related construction activities.
    • Prepares bid documents, bid technical evaluation, and material quantity survey/estimates.
    • Responsible for the preparation of ensures project completion within the allowed timetable, sees to it that plans & specifications are met.
    • Prepares material quantity surveys and estimates, ensuring accuracy and adherence to project budgets.
    • Monitors and evaluates Owner Supplied Materials (OSM) for quality and quantity compliance.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
Responsibilities

As a member of the Mechanical Design team, the candidate will be responsible for the design of mechanical components for Probe Cards and Probe Heads, as well as related tooling. The candidate will implement innovative and effective solutions, considering potential manufacturing issues, customer needs, product optimization, and cost and process improvements.

Specific Responsibilities Include

  • Design of high-precision mechanical components;
  • Improvement of new or existing product designs;
  • Updating product design specifications;
  • Preparation of high-quality technical reports using test/production data or mechanical simulations;
  • Design of equipment necessary for the production of Technoprobe products;
  • FEM simulation of mechanical parts;
  • Development of SW applications for mechanical design.

Requirements

  • Master&aposs degree in Mechanical Engineering is preferred;
  • Knowledge of mechanical design with experience in designing high-precision components;
  • Excellent English language skills;
  • Proficiency in 2D and 3D modeling tools (PTC Creo and AutoCAD).

title: Project Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
Company Description

Aboitiz Foods is an integrated regional food and agribusiness company dedicated to creating a high-performance culture anchored on our time-honored values of Integrity, Teamwork, Innovation, and Responsibility. Through the collective strengths of our subsidiaries, Pilmico and Gold Coin, we believe in sustainably feeding Asias growth from mill to meal.

We are constantly improving and optimizing our processes by integrating the value chain around Asia. We leverage our sector expertise and capabilities to deliver quality every time. With our world-class technology and culture of constant innovation, we devote ourselves to serving you better.

At Aboitiz Foods, we embrace change and inspire innovation, leading the way in food and agribusiness solutions. Join us as we shape the future of food in Asia and build a culture where, together, we nourish the future.

Job Description

Job Objective : The Project Mechanical Engineer is responsible in the successful planning, design, cost

estimation, execution, overseeing implementation and documentation of all aspects of the

identified mechanical projects.

Key Duties And Responsibilities

  • Develop project objectives by reviewing project proposal in accordance to engineering principles.
  • Engages project requester & stakeholders in gathering project requirements.
  • Collaborate in the interpretation & establishment of the desired project outcome based on gathered requirement into a detailed plan that can be implemented by the project team.
  • Oversees project implementation ensuring that execution is in accordance to design specifications & methodology, within scope, budget and schedule. Any deviation shall be immediately resolved and/or communicated to the project team and project sponsor/owner.
  • Minimize project risks by identifying potential risks during design and implementation ensuring that preventive action plans are defined, communicated throughout the project cycle.
  • Changes in the project scope affecting budget & schedule shall be communicated so that proper change request is managed.
  • Ensure all relevant safety objectives and legal requirements are observed for all work completed. Violation on safety protocols are documented & reported for proper handling.
  • Ensures the quality of the project by defining it, committing to it, manage it, perform quality checking; control & correcting, focusing on the scope & requirements & document lessons learned throughout the project cycle.
  • Keeps & maintain accurate plans, records and files according to quality management standard.
  • Provides assistance in the procurement of goods & services by handling technical review of potential vendors or service providers for project with upmost integrity & impartiality.
  • Recommends award for implementation of projects.
  • Ensures compliance of food safety and good housekeeping based on the standard requirements of 5S, GMP, HACCP, ISO, ERM and Halal.
  • Regularly communicates & send updates on the status of the projects being handled.
  • Performs other related task as may be assigned by the immediate superior.

Food Safety

  • Complies with quality, Halal, health and food safety policy, standards and regulations of the company.
  • Responsible for reporting problems related to Halal, food safety & quality management system to identified authorities.

Other Tasks

  • Actively participate in all company programs and activities under quality improvement, safety & security, sustainability, corporate social responsibility, risk management etc.
  • Performs other tasks related to the job as may be assigned by the immediate superior.

Qualifications

Education:

  • Graduate of Mechanical Engineering

Experience

  • At least 2 years of experience in Mechanical designing, fabrication and installation and other related work.

Licenses

  • Must be a Licensed Mechanical Engineer

Other Requirements

  • Has lots of initiative
  • Good organizational skills
  • Ability to communicate well, both written and oral.
  • Knowledgeable on basic ACAD operation and has ability to explain design ideas & plans clearly.
  • Effective technical skills.
  • Fundamental knowledge mechanical design and its application in automation industrial designs.

Additional Information

Physical Effort

  • Light work requiring little physical effort

Working Conditions And Hazards

  • Occasional exposure to some disagreeable elements

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
• Project Engineering
  • Project Engineering tasks such as finalize P&ID, equipment & pipe sizing, prepare all technical detail, cost estimate before sending RFQ (request for quotation) to suppliers .
  • Give inputs to Tech. Design to produce all kind of drawings (P&ID, Layout, Platform, 3D, etc.) which required for a project & then review them.
  • Writing process description or FDS (functional design specificaiotn) for Automation to develope software.

  • Software & Hardware FAT
  • Site commissioning
  • Maintain documentation during site install, testing and commissioning.

title: Senior Engineer I Procurement Commodity Electro Mechanical
job_desc:
Job Description

Emerson's 130+ years of history have been filled with achievements and challenges that have driven innovative thinking and bold transformations, molding us into the company we are today. By joining us as a Senior Engineer, Procurement, you will be able to apply your knowledge of direct commodities. You will be part of the team that is constantly looking for ways to lower costs on any products and services. You will be supporting eSourcing activities, contract management, product notice change reviews, and risk assessment of parts for direct commodities.

If this sounds like a perfect fit for you, apply now and join our team in Mandaluyong City, Philippines!

In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

  • Work with strategic procurement colleagues to develop new supply sources to support existing and new product requirements.
  • Develop and implement spend management strategies, including supplier assessments, rationalization, and negotiation for the best total cost of ownership.
  • Prepare, co-develop, and review the reverse auction process with Commodity Managers, including detailed bid information, analysis of detailed results, negotiation, and execution of contracts within budgetary limitations and scope of authority.
  • Propose to management on a continuing basis to include commodity cost trends, material availability, production options, and alternatives.
  • Collaborate with both internal and external legal counsel.
  • Ensure up-to-date and manage changes in the procurement database.

Who You Are:

You have a strong drive for results and exhibit passion and enthusiasm to get things done. You're a proactive self-starter with a strong sense of urgency in meeting tasks and deadlines. You can proficiently communicate ideas, collaborate, and efficiently work with people at any level.

For This Role, You Will Need:

  • Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering, Operations Management, Supply Chain, Purchasing, or other Engineering/Management-related courses.
  • At least 3.5 years of relevant experience in Procurement function in the manufacturing industry or supply chain role in the shared services industry.
  • Knowledgeable in mechanical and electrical/electronic commodities.
  • Knowledgeable in environmental legislations (e.g., ROHS, REACH, etc.).
  • Fair degree of understanding in the field of Supply Chain and knowledge of Project Management.
  • Basic understanding of procurement systems and tools (ERP, MRP, SRM).
  • Basic understanding of Online Reverse Auction.

Our Offer to You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. We attract, develop, and retain outstanding people in an inclusive environment where all employees can reach their greatest potential.

At Emerson, we are committed to creating a global workplace that supports and embraces inclusion. We are dedicated to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives.

Join us and be part of a proud and thriving organization that values its people. Enjoy our market-competitive pay and benefits package, including food and transportation allowances, comprehensive insurance coverage, retirement benefits, and more. We invest in your growth with career development programs and reward your achievements through merit-based increases. We provide exceptional healthcare coverage for you and your loved ones, as well as paid leaves and tuition reimbursement for approved programs. Our well-being programs, exciting business travel opportunities, safe working environment, and commitment to social responsibility ensure you thrive personally and professionally. Be part of a team that not only values your contributions but also cares about your growth, well-being, and success. Let's take the leap and experience a fulfilling career with us. Let's Go!

About Us

WHY EMERSON

Our Commitment to Our People

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world's most complex problems for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You'll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.

At Emerson, you'll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let's go. Let's think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let's go, together.

Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: [HIDDEN TEXT] .

About Emerson

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you're an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you'll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team let's go!

No calls or agencies please.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
POSITION OVERVIEW

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Building Services Mechanical Engineer for our Philippine Region. Your role is primarily responsible for delivering high level and effective mechanical engineering services to the WalkerBai Group.

The Mechanical Engineer is a vital member of our team, entrusted with designing, evaluating, and validating Mechanical Engineering Services across diverse projects. This role entails ensuring adherence to regulatory standards, enhancing safety measures within built environments, and partnering with multi-disciplinary teams to seamlessly integrate mechanical solutions into project designs.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Project Delivery

Responsible for managing the design and documentation of mechanical services HVAC projects under guidance of senior mechanical engineers.

Manage the delivery of quality design documentation capturing any variation to project scope and communicating all resourcing requirements and project headlines to the project lead.

Manage senior mechanical engineers expectations and concerns.

SUCCESS MEASURES:

  • Projects completed on time and within scope/budget.
  • Projects managed effectively to meet deadlines.
  • Production of high-quality mechanical documentation.

TECHNICAL LEADERSHIP

Key Responsibilities:

  • Model our values and contribute positively to our team culture.
  • Recognise and highlight positive culture contribution within the teams.
  • Encourage and participate in inter-discipline collaboration.
  • Assist our team with workflow, workload, and project queries.
  • Ensure the team are aware of, comply with, and uphold technical standards and project requirements.
  • Remain up to date with current Australian Codes and Regulations.
  • Investigate and implement best practices in engineering techniques.
  • Actively share your depth of industry knowledge with the team.

Success Measures:

  • A positive team culture and supportive environment.
  • Actively seeks to review technical issues with team members.
  • Demonstrates ability to take on feedback and improve.
  • Team members understand and comply with quality standards and project requirements.

Skills required:

  • Experience in the end-to-end design and documentation of mechanical services on a wide variety of project types and sizes from concept to tender/construction issue.
  • Experience coordinating mechanical services with other design disciplines.
  • Excellent communication both written and verbal with all stakeholders.
  • Good understanding of Australian Building Codes & Standards.
  • Strong organization and time management skills
  • Experience using thermal heat load calculation software, Camel, Carrier or IES.
  • Documentation experience with AutoCAD, Revit, BIM 360.

title: Mechanical Engineer (Senior)
job_desc:
Responsibilities:
  • Utilize your extensive knowledge of heavy industry equipment design to conceptualize and develop robust engineering solutions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including R&D, manufacturing, and quality assurance to ensure seamless integration of design concepts.
  • Perform detailed engineering analysis and calculations to validate the design integrity and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
  • Create 3D models, assembly drawings, and technical documentation using industry-standard CAD software.
  • Conduct prototype testing and analysis to identify areas for improvement and optimize equipment performance.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practices to drive continuous improvement and innovation.
Qualifications:
  • Bacheloru0027s degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
  • Proven track record of at least 5 years in agricultural and heavy industry equipment design, with a focus on conceptualization, development, and optimization.
  • Strong proficiency in CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD) and other relevant engineering tools.
  • Deep understanding of mechanical principles, material selection, structural analysis, and manufacturing processes related to heavy industry equipment.
    Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to develop creative solutions for complex engineering challenges.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with industry standards and regulations governing heavy industry equipment design, such as ASME, ISO, and ANSI.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
Responsibilities

  • Plans and organize relevant materials and tools prior to job site work and work as efficiently and economically as possible.
  • Monitors equipment to ensure maintenance schedules are strictly adhered.

  • Overhauls process machinery including critical equipment like kinyon pumps, compressors, mill reducer, roots blower, air separator, weighing feeder.

  • Prepare technical reports and documentation on maintenance projects for improvement related to revision and modification works.

Qualifications

  • Graduate of Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering.

  • Knowledgeable in AutoCAD 2D/3D, ERP System, MS Project, Equipment Maintenance, and ISO Documentation.
  • Must be willing to be assigned to the Bulacan plant (board and lodging provided).

title: Technical Facility Coordinator (Mechanical Engineer)
job_desc:
Act as front liners who will be hands-on in doing the facilities quick fix repairs and maintenance, vendor coordination/assistance

Reporting to Engineer and will communicate as well for the status update Data Center equipment under repair/maintenance, and other urgent facility issues or concerns.

Carry out maintenance and improvement work ensuring all procedures, processes, and client requirements are taken into consideration.

Maintain various equipment and facilities to ensure good operating condition in accordance with the agreed maintenance plan. Maximize efficiency with minimal maintenance and energy costs.

Routine inspection and control of all areas under clients lease agreement with the landlord.

Reading of utility meters and maintaining of data collected.

When problem about the premises occurs, act as first line of defense. Investigate the cause before the arrival of maintenance contractor, try to maintain and recover normal operation.

Ensure all technical services works are complying to Critical Environment Management procedures.

Work closely with contractors and vendors on a regular basis, conducting risk assessment and following safety protocols, ensuring compliance to submitted SWMS and work procedures.

title: Mechanical Engineer for Bacolod Project
job_desc:
We are seeking a skilled and motivated Mechanical Engineer to join our team for exciting Buildings & Infrastructure projects in Bacolod City. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in overseeing construction activities related to the Mechanical, Electrical, Fire Protection, and Sanitation (MEFPS) trades, ensuring the highest standards of quality, safety, and compliance throughout the project lifecycle. This position offers the opportunity to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and tackle complex engineering challenges on-site.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Monitor and supervise the construction works of MEFPS trade contractors to ensure adherence to plans, specifications, and industry best practices.
  • Conduct site inspections, testing, and commissioning to verify compliance with established standards, specifications, and methodologies.
  • Implement and promote total quality work processes, along with strict adherence to health and safety protocols on-site.
  • Coordinate with designers and consultants to address site conditions, design challenges, and modifications.
  • Participate in technical coordination meetings with contractors and utility providers, facilitating timely resolutions of on-site implementation issues.
  • Take on additional tasks as assigned, contributing to the smooth execution of the project.

Job Requirements:

  • Must be a Registered Mechanical Engineer (RME).
  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in mechanical engineering within the construction industry.
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and AutoCAD.
  • Experience with SketchUp and project management tools is a plus.
  • Strong ability to work efficiently under pressure and meet deadlines.
  • Immediate availability to start.
  • Willingness to relocate.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
The Team

Our Building Services teams mission is to play a key role in making buildings more energy efficient, sustainable, cost effective and safe to build and operate. We pride ourselves on our exemplary track record of designing innovative and sustainable mechanical and electrical solutions, that minimise the use of natural resources.

Our global Building Services team are a source of world leading expertise and offer a pro-active and collaborative approach to skill development, and professional excellence.

Our Philippines operations represents Cundall as our Regional Centre of excellence for Data Centre design, Sustainability, and Building Services.

The Role

This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated and aspiring Mechanical Building Services engineer to join our pioneer team based in our Philippines, Makati office, to work on some of the most exciting building projects within Cundall in the region.

Working across a variety of sectors such as Education, Commercial, Retail and Critical Systems, you will work closely with colleagues of various disciplines to manage the delivery of technically-excellent, profitable projects. You will have the opportunity over time to assume greater levels of responsibility and autonomy as your professional skills develop and will be supported towards obtaining Chartership.

The Skills

Educated to degree level in Mechanical Engineering or Building Services Engineering (MEng or BEng or equivalent) and having gained broad experience in a Mechanical Engineering role within a building services context (ventilation, cooling and air conditioning, heating systems etc), you have proven your technical expertise in relevant design software including Revit, IES, CYMAP and/or Hevacomp, and have a portfolio of experience demonstrating your quality and client focussed approach.Data Center and Critical Systems experience will be highly regarded.

In your most recent position, you have consistently demontrated your ability to work on multiple projects with the assistance of Senior engineers to deliver to, and exceed linet expectations, and crucially - you have a passion for creative and intuitive design.

Given the collaborative and client focused nature of this role, excellent communication and project management skills are essential.

Job Description

 We know that to be the best at what we do we need a diverse workforce underpinned by an inclusive culture. Creating environments where everyone can find joy doing their best work is also great for everyone. Thats why we positively welcome applications from people of all backgrounds and identities, and encourage, support, and celebrate the diverse voices of our people.

Licensed Mechanical Engineer

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
Discover your 100% YOU with MicroSourcing!

Position: Mechanical Engineer
Location: Global One, Eastwood
Work setup & shift: Dayshift - WFH

Why join MicroSourcing

Youu0027ll have:
  • Competitive Rewards: Enjoy above-market compensation, healthcare coverage on day one, plus one or more dependents, paid time-off with cash conversion, group life insurance, and performance bonuses
  • A Collaborative Spirit: Contribute to a positive and engaging work environment by participating in company-sponsored events and activities.
  • Work-Life Harmony: Enjoy the balance between work and life that suits you with flexible work arrangements.
  • Career Growth: Take advantage of opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement.
  • Inclusive Teamwork: Be part of a team that celebrates diversity and fosters an inclusive culture.

Your Role:

As a Mechanical Engineer, you will:

You will work alongside the existing design and projects team to validate and optimize new and redesigned earthmoving and material handling attachments. This role involves conducting Finite Element Analyses (FEA) for static, dynamic, and fatigue simulations. The position covers all stages of product development-from research and design to manufacturing-while considering budget and operational factors.

Engineering & Design
  • Design products from initial conception to workshop drawings, collaborating with other departments using CAD software such as SolidWorks (high proficiency required).
  • Serve as both a Draftsperson and Design Engineer, fostering professionalism and teamwork.
  • Re-engineer past designs to optimize products for improved performance.
  • Create and update Bills of Material (BOM) in CAD and ERP systems.
  • Prepare workshop drawings for existing and modified designs.
  • Conduct Finite Element Analysis (FEA) on new and existing designs, analyzing static loads, dynamic loads, impact, and fatigue.
  • Discuss and resolve complex engineering problems with manufacturing and production teams, sub-contractors, suppliers, and customers.
Project & Quality Management
  • Perform Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA) on new designs and concepts.
  • Manage projects using engineering principles and techniques to ensure efficiency.
  • Develop detailed specifications and outline designs while adhering to relevant design standards, manufacturing processes, and parts procurement requirements.
  • Recommend design modifications based on prototype FEA and test results.
  • Apply research, analytical, and planning skills for Value Engineering initiatives.
  • Consider the impact of cost, safety, and time constraints in the design process.
Qualifications & Skills:
  • Tertiary qualification in Mechanical Engineering.
  • 3+ years of experience in Mechanical Engineering.
  • Knowledge of earthmoving machinery and attachments (preferred).
  • 3+ years of experience in detailed mechanical design using SolidWorks.
  • Experience in Process Improvement & Continuous Improvement.
  • People management experience.
  • Understanding of Occupational Health & Safety (OH&S) requirements.
  • Experience in Strategic Planning and Quality Management.
  • A positive, proactive attitude with strong attention to detail.
  • SolidWorks certification (preferred).
  • Prior experience in designing heavy machinery and/or attachments (preferred).

What You Need:
Non-negotiables
  • Bacheloru0027s degree in Marketing, Communications or a related field.
  • 3-5 years of experience in digital marketing, preferably in the fire and life safety industry.
  • Expert in WordPress site management, including content updates, webpage creation, plugins, and site maintenance.
  • Proficiency in using digital marketing tools such as Google Ads, Google Analytics, SEMrush, and WordPress.
  • Strong knowledge of both onsite and offsite SEO best practices.
  • Excellent analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to make informed decisions.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent organizational and project management skills.

About MicroSourcing

With over 9,000 professionals across 13 delivery centers, MicroSourcing is the pioneer and largest offshore provider of managed services in the Philippines.

Our commitment to 100% YOU

MicroSourcing firmly believes that our companyu0027s strength lies in our peopleu0027s diversity and talent. We are proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces individuals of all races, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and backgrounds. We provide space for everyone, embracing different perspectives, and making room for opportunities for each individual to thrive.

At MicroSourcing, equality is not merely a slogan - itu0027s our commitment. Our way of life. Here, we donu0027t just accept your unique authentic self - we celebrate it, valuing every individualu0027s contribution to our collective success and growth. Join us in celebrating YOU and your 100%!

For more information, visit https://www.microsourcing.com/

title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer
job_desc:
WSP, a world leading management and consultancy firm, connects you to a vast array of opportunities. We are a collaborative team of experts that thrives on challenge and unconventional thinking. At WSP we make extraordinary efforts to attract, develop, engage and retain the best professionals in our fields of expertise because this is what makes us great.

What We&aposll Love About You:

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

What You&aposll Love About Us:

We believe that a blend of empowerment and responsibility results in outstanding achievements. We hold all of our colleagues to the same above-average standards, while providing them with the tools, training and support they need to craft their own journeys.

Join us in doing purposeful work, helping our communities thrive today, while shaping them for tomorrow

title: Resident Engineer - Electrical/Mechanical/Civil Engineer
company: SM Engineering Design and Development Corp.
job_desc:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

The Tasks/Responsibilities of the position are as follows:

Bid Evaluation

  • Creates bid/buying specifications, guidelines and standards for Land and Building Improvement projects (e.g. installation guidelines, synopsis template, etc.)
  • Assesses previous project implementations
  • Conducts case studies and innovation studies.
  • Initiates system improvements based on historical data and other references (e.g. cost standardization, contractor mapping, etc.)
  • Assists the Project Owners during negotiation by providing pre-assessment of quotations and project details.
  • Handles comprehensive evaluation of projects for approval based on the following, but not limited to, compliance to specifications and standards, OPEX and CAPEX analysis, technical analysis and contractors performance.

Project Management

  • Monitors contract terms thru warranty trackers
  • Monitors status, project timelines and milestones of on-going projects.
  • Handles Roof Management Committee (RMC) Roof Replacement, Waterproofing, Protective Coating, and all Land and Building Improvement projects (LBI)
  • Consolidates and analyzes reports, and issues and concerns of all malls nationwide for project under RMC and LBI; to be discussed during weekly/monthly meetings
  • Directs and collaborates with Technical Heads and Project Owners to generate their regional reports and to help further improve the committee
  • Coordinates with RMC and LBI contractors to help Project Owners resolve their major issues and concerns.
  • Consolidates, generates and analyzes Contractors Performance Evaluation ratings from all mall nationwide- to be reported to all stakeholders
  • Ensures contractors compliance to the bid documents (approves plans and specifications) during the entire project implementation.
  • Organizes and facilitates centralized pre-bid meetings for all CapEx and OpEx projects.
  • Close coordination with NDT for Design Standard Criteria verification

QA/QC

  • Conducts spot audit on site to ensure compliance to specifications and standards
  • Consolidates audit/close-out reports on on-going projects to ensure compliance to specifications and standards.
  • Punchlists all new constructed malls before turnover to EDD Operations

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

title: Mechanical Project Engineer
location: Cagayan De Oro, Northern Mindanao, Philippines

title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer
job_desc:
The Role

We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our Design Lab. The ideal candidate will lead the design, development, and manufacturing of structural and mechanical components for mass production, ensuring high-quality architectural hardware solutions. This role requires strong technical expertise, creativity, and a passion for sustainable innovation.

  • Conduct Finite Element Analysis (FEA) to ensure product durability and efficiency.
  • Develop advanced 3D models for manufacturing using software such as Creo and SolidWorks.
  • Provide technical solutions for element design and optimize mechanical systems for high-volume production.
  • Prepare detailed documentation for manufacturing processes, including technical drawings and product specifications.
  • Conduct research on new materials and their applications for sustainable housing.
  • Design structural components for mass production, ensuring compatibility with manufacturing limitations.
  • Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to drive innovative design solutions.
  • Use design tools like DFMEA, DoE, FEA, GD&T, and tolerance stack analysis.
  • Engage with suppliers and partners, including Mandarin-speaking collaborators, to streamline production and quality control.
  • Occasionally travel to oversee manufacturing processes and supplier relationships.

Skills & Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in Mechanical, Manufacturing, or Engineering fields.
  • 5 years or more of relevant experience, preferably in mass production and product design.
  • Proficiency in 3D CAD modeling and 2D drawing creation.
  • Expertise in analysis software such as ANSYS, Abaqus, Patran, and SimScale.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills for complex mechanical systems.
  • Fluent in English; Mandarin proficiency is a plus.
  • Passionate about technology, innovation, and sustainable design.

title: Building Services Engineer - Mechanical Systems
job_desc:
The job of our MEP Engineer is a crucial part of our product offering; delivering the most advanced work environments for our clients. We are looking for a MEP Engineer with 3+ years of experience who is skilled and experienced in all areas of Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing, design & BIM Coordination. You will have a diverse background and be ready to lead internal and external project teams in all MEP Engineering related services through the entire project life-cycle. You will take special consideration, guiding our design-build teams through design intent to preserve the design quality of a project, mitigating potential later issues during construction. As our Building Services Engineer, you will be responsible for day-to-day management of the engineering related project elements and will be responsible to manage several projects at different stages at the same time.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Support remote conceptual engineering teams through conducting detailed calculations, equipment and infrastructure sizing, development of line drawings, diagrams and layouts.
  • Work with our regional engineering and project teams in North America, Europe and Singapore teams to define project scope, scheduling, budgeting, construction costs and BIM Coordination.
  • Review calculations and drawings developed by third party consultants to support our regional teams to manage the building engineering services, sub-trade subcontractors and technical personnel to ensure design, costing, timing and quality are in line with project requirements
  • Research local code, certification requirements, and general client requirements for MEP services to support the project.
  • Documentation / development of technical due diligence reports, code compliance reports, gap studies, Basis of design, etc.
  • Development of AI tools to support our regional teams and improve overall quality and efficiency of MEP design.
  • Assist PM and procurement team for technical and commercial evaluation, Value engineering solutions during bidding process.
  • Coordination with our regional teams and external consultant for MEP services coordination.
  • Day-to-day management of the engineering related project elements
  • Check develop concept MEP design and oversee development of detailed design documentation
  • Conduct T&C procedures and write T&C plans
  • Partner with internal teams to develop and pitch new project proposals that win new work

Qualifications & Key Competencies

  • 3+ years of work experience specializing in various Engineering services within the building design and construction field.
  • Experienced in a various Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing disciplines, Design & BIM Coordination
  • Familiar with relevant codes and standards in North America and / or Europe.
  • University Degree in Building Services Engineering or related field (Electrical and Mechanical).
  • Experience in Managerial or Supervisory position
  • Experience inspecting and supervising various MEP disciplines during construction and provide solutions to overcome site problems
  • Highly skilled in MS office suite and CAD software
  • Coordinating & reviewing MEP Design BOQ and documentation with third party consultants, vendors (internal & external stakeholders)
  • Able to conduct a T&C procedure and write T&C plan

Successful applicants will be reporting to Sustainability Team in London but will be based in Manila.
